intro: Oreocharis lancifolia var. mucronata, commonly known as the sharp-leaved oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellowish in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
